page.title: 12LOWDHAM BY-PASS.
page.content: Lowdham is a village that has been divided into two parts by it's by-pass. The by-pass was first built during the 1930's and later extended.It now diverts the main A6097,which links Doncaster and Leicester,away from the main part of the village. However the by-pass does not pass around the village but cuts it pratically in half. Most of the children who were asked whether they preferred to have a by-pass did so,but they wished it had gone around the outside of the village as it is now a very dangerous road to cross.It is especially difficult for those people who live across the by-pass from the shops.
